course_title: EPI Seminar: R Bootcamp for Epidemiology
class_notes: R Bootcamp: Pre-requisite: EPI 534, BIOS 544, or similar R course.  This course introduces best practices for conducting reproducible epidemiologic analyses in R. Topics include the R project and package management system, reproducible tables and statistical output, writing reports or manuscripts in quarto, developing a workflow using the targets package, and version control using Git/GitHub. This fast-paced course will intersperse short lectures with activities in R, building up to a full-blown reproducible project. This is a pre-term class that will meet August 14th and 15th, 9am-5pm.
course_description: Various topics by Epi faculty. Check OPUS/Atlas for current topics and descriptions.
schedule_location: MT 8am-5pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. RL20
sections: Class Nbr: 6612, Section #: 3, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MT 8a-5p, Instructor: Christiansen-Lindquist/Bourne, Status: Open
